questions.text: A global company with a large number of AWS accounts is seeking a way in which they can centrally manage billing and security policies across all accounts. Which AWS Service will assist them in meeting these goals?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. AWS Organizations allows centralized management of multiple AWS accounts, including consolidated billing and security policies.

questions.text: Which service provides object-level storage in AWS?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Amazon S3 is AWS's object storage service, while EBS/EFS are block/file storage respectively.

questions.text: A company is concerned that they are spending money on underutilized compute resources in AWS. Which AWS feature will help ensure that their applications are automatically adding/removing EC2 compute capacity to closely match the required demand?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. AWS Auto Scaling automatically adjusts EC2 capacity based on demand to optimize costs.

questions.text: Which S3 storage class is best for data with unpredictable access patterns?

options.text: B. Amazon S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves objects between tiers based on access patterns, ideal for unpredictable usage.

questions.text: What is the AWS database service that allows you to upload data structured in key-value format?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL database service for key-value and document data.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding Amazon EC2 On-demand instances?

options.text: A. You have to pay a start-up fee when launching a new instance for the first time.
B. The on-demand instances follow the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model.
C. With on-demand instances, no longer-term commitments or upfront payments are needed.
D. When using on-demand Linux instances, you are charged per second based on an hourly rate.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. On-demand instances have no startup fees - you only pay for compute capacity by the second/hour.

questions.text: A company has moved to AWS recently. Which of the following AWS Services will help ensure that they have the proper security settings? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and B. Trusted Advisor checks security best practices, while Inspector performs automated security assessments.

questions.text: What is the AWS feature that provides an additional level of security above the default authentication mechanism of usernames and passwords?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of protection beyond just passwords.

questions.text: A company is introducing a new product to their customers, and is expecting a surge in traffic to their web application. As part of their Enterprise Support plan, which of the following provides the company with architectural and scaling guidance?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Infrastructure Event Management (IEM) provides architectural guidance for high-traffic events.

questions.text: You work as an on-premises MySQL DBA. The work of database configuration, backups, patching, and DR can be time-consuming and repetitive. Your company has decided to migrate to the AWS Cloud. Which of the following can help save time on database maintenance so you can focus on data architecture and performance?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Amazon RDS manages routine database tasks like backups, patching, and recovery automatically.

questions.text: Which of the below is a best-practice when designing solutions on AWS?

options.text: A. Invest heavily in architecting your environment, as it is not easy to change your design later.
B. Use AWS reservations to reduce costs when testing your production environment.
C. Automate wherever possible to make architectural experimentation easier.
D. Provision a large compute capacity to handle any spikes in load

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Automation enables rapid iteration and experimentation with architectures.

questions.text: According to the AWS Acceptable Use Policy, which of the following statements is true regarding penetration testing of EC2 instances?

options.text: A. Penetration testing is not allowed in AWS.
B. Penetration testing is performed automatically by AWS to determine vulnerabilities in your AWS infrastructure.
C. Penetration testing can be performed by the customer on their own instances without prior authorization from AWS.
D. The AWS customers are only allowed to perform penetration testing on services managed by AWS.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. AWS allows customers to test their own EC2 instances without prior approval.

questions.text: Which service is used to ensure that messages between software components are not lost if one or more components fail?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) provides reliable message queuing for decoupled systems.

questions.text: The principle "design for failure and nothing will fail" is very important when designing your AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following would help adhere to this principle? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and C. Using multiple AZs (B) and ELB (C) creates redundancy to handle failures.

questions.text: What is the AWS service that provides a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) provides isolated network environments.

questions.text: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Managing environmental events of AWS data centers.
B. Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3.
C. Controlling physical access to AWS Regions.
D. Ensuring that the underlying EC2 host is configured properly.
E. Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and E. Customers manage data protection (B) and application management (E), while AWS handles physical security.

questions.text: Which of the following AWS services can be used as a compute resource? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: D and E. EC2 provides virtual servers, while Lambda runs serverless functions.

questions.text: Your company is designing a new application that will store and retrieve photos and videos. Which of the following services should you recommend as the underlying storage mechanism?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Amazon S3 is ideal for storing and retrieving unstructured data like photos/videos.

questions.text: Which of the following is equivalent to a user name and password and is used to authenticate your programmatic access to AWS services and APIs?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Access keys (access key ID + secret access key) authenticate API/CLI requests.

questions.text: What does Amazon ElastiCache provide?

options.text: A. In-memory caching for read-heavy applications.
B. An Ehcache compatible in-memory data store.
C. An online software store that allows Customers to launch pre-configured software with just few clicks.
D. A domain name system in the cloud.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. ElastiCache provides Redis/Memcached for low-latency, in-memory caching.

questions.text: What is the AWS service that enables you to manage all of your AWS accounts from a single master account?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. AWS Organizations centralizes account management with consolidated billing and policy enforcement.

questions.text: Which of the following EC2 instance purchasing options supports the Bring Your Own License (BYOL) model for almost every BYOL scenario?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Dedicated Hosts allow you to use existing server-bound software licenses (BYOL).

questions.text: Which of the following is one of the benefits of moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to AWS?

options.text: A. Free support for all enterprise customers.
D. AWS holds responsibility for managing customer applications.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Cloud computing converts capital expenses (CapEx) to operational expenses (OpEx).

questions.text: Which of the following are important design principles you should adopt when designing systems on AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Always use Global Services in your architecture rather than Regional Services.
B. Always choose to pay as you go.
C. Treat servers as fixed resources.
E. Remove single points of failure.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: D and E. Automation (D) and fault tolerance (E) are core AWS design principles.

questions.text: Which AWS Service can be used to establish a dedicated, private network connection between AWS and your datacenter?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. AWS Direct Connect provides dedicated network connections bypassing the public internet.

questions.text: You are working on two projects that require completely different network configurations. Which AWS service or feature will allow you to isolate resources and network configurations?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Multiple VPCs provide complete network isolation between projects.

questions.text: Which of the following services can help protect your web applications from SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in your application code?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF) protects against common web exploits like SQL injection.

questions.text: An organization needs to analyze and process a large number of data sets. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Amazon EMR provides managed Hadoop/Spark frameworks for big data processing.

questions.text: Based on the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following are the sole responsibility of AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: B. Installing software on EC2 instances.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: C and E. AWS manages the hypervisor (C) and physical hardware (E) in the cloud.

questions.text: What is the AWS service that provides you the highest level of control over the underlying virtual infrastructure?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. EC2 provides the most control as it's Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS).

questions.text: What are the default security credentials that are required to access the AWS management console for an IAM user account?

options.text: C. A user name and password.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. IAM users access the console with username/password (API/CLI requires access keys).

questions.text: In your on-premises environment, you can create as many virtual servers as you need from a single template. What can you use to perform the same in AWS?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) serve as templates for launching EC2 instances.

questions.text: What are two advantages of using Cloud Computing over using traditional data centers? (Choose TWO)

options.text: B. Eliminating Single Points of Failure (SPOFs).

questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and C. Cloud provides built-in fault tolerance (B) and global distribution (C).

questions.text: Which of the following aspects of security are managed by AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: D and E. AWS manages physical security (E) and hardware maintenance (D).

questions.text: Which statement best describes the operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

options.text: A. The ability of a system to recover gracefully from failure.
B. The efficient use of computing resources to meet requirements.
C. The ability to monitor systems and improve supporting processes and procedures.
D. The ability to manage datacenter operations more efficiently.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Operational Excellence focuses on monitoring, processes, and continuous improvement.

questions.text: AWS has created a large number of Edge Locations as part of its Global Infrastructure. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using Edge Locations?

options.text: A. Edge locations are used by CloudFront to cache the most recent responses.
B. Edge locations are used by CloudFront to improve your end users' experience when uploading files.
C. Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute traffic across multiple instances to reduce latency.
D. Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute content to global users with low latency.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Edge Locations cache content but don't distribute traffic across instances (that's ELB's function).

questions.text: What are the change management tools that helps AWS customers audit and monitor all resource changes in their AWS environment? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and E. CloudTrail logs API calls while Config tracks resource configurations over time.

questions.text: Which of the following services allows you to run containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) is AWS's managed container orchestration service.

questions.text: Which of the following services will help businesses ensure compliance in AWS?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. CloudTrail provides audit logs of all API calls for compliance purposes.

questions.text: Which of the following procedures will help reduce your Amazon S3 costs?

options.text: A. Use the Import/Export feature to move old files automatically to Amazon Glacier.
B. Use the right combination of storage classes based on different use cases.
C. Pick the right Availability Zone for your S3 bucket.
D. Move all the data stored in S3 standard to EBS.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Matching storage classes (e.g., Intelligent-Tiering, Glacier) to access patterns optimizes costs.

questions.text: What are the AWS services/features that can help you maintain a highly available and fault-tolerant architecture in AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and C. Auto Scaling (B) and ELB (C) distribute workloads across healthy instances.

questions.text: Which of the following activities may help reduce your AWS monthly costs?

options.text: A. Enabling Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling for all of your workloads.
B. Using the AWS Network Load Balancer (NLB) to load balance the incoming HTTP requests.
C. Removing all of your Cost Allocation Tags.
D. Deploying your AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Auto Scaling optimizes costs by matching capacity to actual demand.

questions.text: What is the AWS service/feature that takes advantage of Amazon CloudFront's globally distributed edge locations to transfer files to S3 with higher upload speeds?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. S3 Transfer Acceleration uses CloudFront edge locations as fast upload endpoints.

questions.text: Which of the following AWS security features is associated with an EC2 instance and functions to filter incoming traffic requests?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Security Groups act as stateful firewalls at the instance level.

questions.text: Which AWS services can be used to improve the performance of a global application and reduce latency for its users? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and E. Global Accelerator (B) and CloudFront (E) optimize traffic routing through AWS's global network.

questions.text: Using Amazon RDS falls under the shared responsibility model. Which of the following are customer responsibilities? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Building the relational database schema.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and C. Customers manage data/schema (A) and configuration (C), while AWS handles backups/patches.

questions.text: A company has a large amount of structured data stored in their on-premises data center. They are planning to migrate all the data to AWS, what is the most appropriate AWS database option?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Amazon RDS is ideal for migrating structured relational databases to AWS.

questions.text: A company has created a solution that helps AWS customers improve their architectures on AWS. Which AWS program may support this company?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. APN Consulting Partners provide AWS architecture guidance and implementation services.

questions.text: What is the AWS serverless service that allows you to run your applications without any administrative burden?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. AWS Lambda runs code without provisioning or managing servers.

questions.text: Jessica is managing an e-commerce web application in AWS. The application is hosted on six EC2 instances. One day, three of the instances crashed; but none of her customers were affected. What has Jessica done correctly in this scenario?

options.text: A. She has properly built an elastic system.
B. She has properly built a fault tolerant system.
C. She has properly built an encrypted system.
D. She has properly built a scalable system.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Fault tolerance ensures continued operation despite component failures.
